intro: Struthanthus rubens, commonly known as the scarlet nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, peppers, and other nightshades. The plant produces showy, bright red flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are usually green and oval-shaped, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Struthanthus rubens is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
